meanings.definition: A heavy iron bar with a flattened end, used as a lever to pry things open.
meanings.sent1: He used a crowbar to lift the heavy rock.
meanings.sent2: The burglar tried to break into the house with a crowbar.
meanings.sent3: The crowbar made the stubborn door finally budge.
meanings.sent4: Her determination was the crowbar that opened new opportunities.
meanings.sent5: The crowbar's steel glinted in the sunlight as it pried the lid off the crate.

meanings.definition: To pry or force open with a crowbar.
meanings.sent1: She had to crowbar the window open to let in some fresh air.
meanings.sent2: The detective crowbarred the truth out of the suspect.
meanings.sent3: He tried to crowbar a smile after a long day at work.
meanings.sent4: The idea of a vacation crowbarred its way into her mind.
meanings.sent5: The team had to crowbar the old door open to access the hidden room.
